Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted for the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be provided to the site using a pre-populated list in the system. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to Study Data Tabulation Model, Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the drug accountability assessments were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the observations at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the Drug Accountability CRF using the date (DADAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DAGRPID

fields.completionInstructions: Record unique group identifier. Sponsor may insert additional instructions to ensure each record has a unique group identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.
fields.implementationNotes: It can be beneficial to use an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question. This group identifier ties together all the tests collected on this horizontal record. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Group ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: DAGRPID
fields.questionText: What is the test group identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DAPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not drug accountability was performed.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned drug accountability was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: General prompt question to be used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing. This may be implemented for all tests collected on the same horizontal record or for each specific test. When mapped to SDTM, the value of DAPERF would apply to all tests on the same record. Use the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DAPERF when implemented on a specific test basis. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable DASTAT. If DAPERF = "N", the value of DASTAT will be "NOT DONE". If DAPERF = "Y", DASTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., DACAT and DASCAT, DATPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTM variable DATESTCD would be populated as DAALL and an appropriate test name (DATEST) provided. See SDTMIG Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DAPERF

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DACAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the type of study treatment for which drug accountability is assessed (e.g., STUDY MEDICATION, RESCUE MEDICATION, COMPARATOR, PLACEBO).
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. If the protocol allows dispensing different types of study treatment (e.g., study medication, rescue medication, run-in medication) the CRF can capture the type of treatment using DACAT. This may be pre-printed on the CRF. If DACAT is not collected (e.g., it is self-evident from the protocol design), it could be populated during the SDTM-based dataset creation process. The value of DACAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DACAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG V3.2 section 6.3.8.2.for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure
fields.label: Category of Drug Accountability Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DACAT
fields.questionText: What was the type of treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DASCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the study treatment dispensed (e.g., DRUG A, DRUG B, BOTTLE 1).
fields.definition: A sub-division of the DACAT values based on user defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined Controlled Terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. If it is known at the time of data collection, the treatment name may be collected in DASCAT (with appropriate, but different than DACAT, grouping values). The value of DASCAT would apply to all measurements on that record when mapped to SDTM. If needed, the CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DASCAT may be used to collect a category for each DATEST. See SDTMIG Section 6.3 for examples on populating DACAT and DASCAT. DASCAT can only be used if there is an DACAT and it must be a subcategorization of DACAT.
fields.label: Subcategory of Drug Accountability Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DASCAT
fields.questionText: What was the name of the treatment for which drug accountability was assessed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DAREFID

fields.definition: An internal or external identifier such as treatment label identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier).
fields.implementationNotes: This packaging identifier (e.g., kit number, bottle label, vial identifier) may be collected in different ways (e.g., affixing label onto CRF or scanning a bar code). For some study dosing regimens, greater granularity for treatment identifiers may be needed. In this situation, sponsors may need to use additional variables. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in EX domain.
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DAREFID
fields.questionText: What is the [DATEST] treatment label identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DADAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date drug accountability was performed, using this format ( DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date the study treatment was dispensed or returned represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: The date study treatment dispensed/returned should be recorded for each dispensation for a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed. A single date may be collected for all the observations when they are performed on the same date. The date of each observation can also be collected using a CDASH variable [DATESTCD]_DADAT. The date of the observation may be determined from a collected date of visit and in such cases a separate measurement date field is not required. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Date of Assessment
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DADTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DADAT
fields.questionText: What was the date [DATEST] drug accountability was assessed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DAORRES

fields.completionInstructions: Record the result of the drug accountability assessment.
fields.definition: Result of the drug accountability assessment (e.g., actual amount).
fields.implementationNotes: Each test may be collected using the CDASH variable [TESTCD] ( e.g., RETAMT) or [TESTCD]_DAORRES where TESTCD is the appropriate CT for the DA test code e.g., RETAMT_DAORRES. For a study with multiple periods or multiple products dispensed, drug accountability amounts should be assessed for each dispensation and return. For the SDTM submission dataset, DAREFID should be used to link related records. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target". In addition to the SDTMIG variable DAORRES, create DATESTCD from the CDASH variable name and derive the value of DATEST from DATESTCD. The CDASH prompt may also contain the DATEST. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DAORRES
fields.questionText: What is the amount of the [DATEST] drug accountability assessment?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78421

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.0

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field DA.Generic.DAORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not pre-printed on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: The unit should be pre-printed on the CRF or a field provided on the CRF to capture it. This CDASH variable name is an example of what "variable name" can be used in a denormalized data structure.
fields.label: Drug Accountability Result Unit
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading "SDTMIG Target".
fields.name: [DATESTCD]_DAORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the [DATEST] result?
